Notes/Considerations: Used to create/identify Plant Individual - harmonized with B2MML terminology.
Used to create/identify Area (Focus Factory) Individual. Links via locatedInPlant to Plant.
Used to create/identify ProcessCell (GH_Area) Individual. Links via partOfArea to Area. Source corrected from PHYSICAL_AREA.
Links via locatedInProcessCell to ProcessCell.
Preferred ID for Equipment Individual. Links via isPartOfProductionLine to ProductionLine. Requires check against EQUIPMENT_TYPE.
Secondary ID. Used to determine EquipmentClass. Consider rdfs:label.
Represents a resource that can be either a ProductionLine or an Equipment. Intended as a superclass or union for the range of involvesResource.
Links Event to the specific Resource (Line OR Equip) it pertains to. Range is the union class ProductionLineOrEquipment.
Links an Area to the Plant it resides in.
Links a ProcessCell (GH_Area) to the Area (Focus Factory) it is part of.
Links a ProductionLine to the ProcessCell it resides in.
Links an Equipment instance to the ProductionLine it is part of.
Represents the descriptive product category name (e.g., "OralCare") directly associated with the Focus Factory (Area).
Represents the product category code (e.g., "OC") directly associated with the Focus Factory (Area). Marked Functional.
Inverse of involvesResource. Links a line or equipment back to events it was involved in. Domain corrected.
Inverse of locatedInPlant. Links Plant to its Areas.
Inverse of partOfArea. Links Area to its ProcessCells.
Inverse of locatedInProcessCell. Links ProcessCell to its ProductionLines.
Inverse of isPartOfProductionLine. Links ProductionLine to its Equipment.
Property of Equipment according to Section 5.5.
Property of Equipment according to Section 5.5.
Property of Equipment according to Section 5.5.
Added for Section 6.4 Operations Capability. Identifier for the capability type.
Links Equipment to capabilities per Section 6.4.
Inverse of hasCapability. Links EquipmentCapability to Equipment.
Parse from EQUIPMENT_NAME to create appropriate EquipmentClass.
Links Equipment instances to their EquipmentClass. Functional assumes equip belongs to one class.
Inverse of memberOfClass. Links EquipmentClass to Equipment instances.
Defines upstream relationship between equipment classes. Use for default sequence relative order.
Defines downstream relationship between equipment classes.
Defines equipment classes that operate in parallel. Deferred/Future: Not required for V1 linear sequence focus.
Required for V1: Numerical position in default sequence (1-based). Functional per class in sequence context.
Deferred/Future: Instance sequence data not available/required for V1.
Deferred/Future: Instance sequence data not available/required for V1.
Deferred/Future: Not required for V1.
Deferred/Future: Instance sequence data not available/required for V1.
Used to create/identify Material Individual per Section 5.7.
Property of Material per Section 5.7. Consider rdfs:comment.
Property of Material per Section 5.7.
Property of Material per Section 5.7. (Functional per Material instance)
Property of Material per Section 5.7. (Functional per Material instance)
Property of Material per Section 5.7. (Functional per Material instance)
Property of Material per Section 5.7. (Functional per Material instance context)
Used to create/identify ProductionRequest per Section 6.1.
Property of ProductionRequest per Section 6.1.
Property of ProductionRequest per Section 6.1. (Functional per Request instance)
Property of ProductionRequest per Section 6.1. (Functional per Request instance)
Links an EventRecord to the ProductionRequest it fulfills or relates to.
Links an EventRecord (representing actual work) to the Material consumed or produced.
Links an EventRecord to the Shift during which it occurred. Functional implies event occurs in exactly one shift.
Links an EventRecord to the OperationalState describing it. Functional implies event has one primary state.
Links an EventRecord to the OperationalReason explaining its state. Functional implies event has one primary reason.

Required V1: Links an equipment-specific event record to the broader line event record it occurred within or contributed to. Domain: EventRecord involving Equipment. Range: EventRecord involving ProductionLine.
Inverse of associatedWithProductionRequest. Links ProductionRequest to EventRecords.
Inverse of usesMaterial. Links Material to EventRecords.
Inverse of duringShift. Links Shift to EventRecords.
Inverse of eventHasState. Links OperationalState to EventRecords.
Inverse of eventHasReason. Links OperationalReason to EventRecords.

Required V1: Inverse of isPartOfLineEvent. Links a line-level event to the specific equipment events that comprise or explain it. Domain: EventRecord involving ProductionLine. Range: EventRecord involving Equipment.
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents total event time in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents Business External time in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents Plant Available time in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents Effective Runtime in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents Plant Decision time in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. Represents Production Available time in minutes. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Captures the specific AE/OEE time category assignment for the event (e.g., Runtime, Unplanned, Plant Decision).
Quantity of good units produced during the event. (Assumed Functional per event).
Quantity of reject units produced during the event. (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration classified as Downtime (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration classified as Runtime (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration where state was not entered/unknown (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration classified as Waiting (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration classified as Plant Experimentation (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Total duration classified as Maintenance (in minutes). (Assumed Functional per event).
Duration classified as Autonomous Maintenance (in minutes). Sub-category of All Maintenance. (Assumed Functional).
Duration classified as Planned Maintenance (in minutes). Sub-category of All Maintenance. (Assumed Functional).
EventRecord links via occursDuring to TimeInterval. (Functional per TimeInterval instance)
Part of the TimeInterval linked by EventRecord. (Functional per TimeInterval instance)
EventRecord links via duringShift to Shift.
Property of Shift per Personnel model. (Functional per Shift instance)
Property of Shift per Personnel model. (Functional per Shift instance)
Property of Shift per Personnel model. (Functional per Shift instance)
Added to align with Section 5.4 Personnel model.
Added for Section 5.4 Personnel model.
Links Person to PersonnelClass per Section 5.4.
Links EventRecord to Person per Section 5.4.
Property of EventRecord per Section 6.3. (Functional per EventRecord instance)
Links EventRecord to TimeInterval. This property is essential for data population. Functional assumes event fully within one interval.
Inverse of memberOfPersonnelClass. Links PersonnelClass to Person members.
Inverse of performedBy. Links Person to EventRecords they perform.
Maps to Ops Record Information (Section 5.10). EventRecord links via eventHasState.
Maps to Ops Event Information (Section 5.11). EventRecord links via eventHasReason.
Property of OperationalReason per Section 5.11.
Property of OperationalReason per Section 5.11.
Property of EventRecord per Section 5.10. Categorical.
Property of OperationalReason for changeover events. Categorical.
Represents the original changeover type code. Allows comparison with changeoverType if needed.
